Key Match Events: Zach LaVine scored 30 points, including 11 in the fourth quarter to key a Chicago comeback.
Nikola Vucevic finished with 22 points for the Bulls.
Josh Giddey finished with 12 points, eight assists, and 13 rebounds, including a key offensive rebound in the final seconds.
Desmond Bane led Memphis with 30 points, making 11 of 19 shots, including 6 of 10 from 3-point range.
Scotty Pippen Jr. had 14 points and 10 assists.
The Bulls led 126-123 after Giddey split a pair of free throws with 8.9 seconds left.
Memphis had the last shot, but Bane's 3-point attempt was off the mark.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chicago used a fourth-quarter rush starting with about nine minutes left, outscoring the Grizzlies 33-23 in the fourth quarter.
Memphis continues to squander leads in the third quarter, giving up a big run to let the Bulls back into the game.
The Bulls were trailing 106-98 when LaVine and Vucevic returned to the floor with about nine minutes left, starting Chicago's comeback.
The Bulls would outscore Memphis 22-6 over the next four minutes, capped by a 3-pointer by LaVine.
Both teams have had trouble early in the season holding onto the ball, but the Bulls committed only nine turnovers, and Memphis had 10.
